name: Buddhist Music
description: Encompassing the various musical practices that have developed throughout Buddhist history and across the many regions Buddhism spread to.

children.name: Beompae
children.description: Korean genre of Buddhist chants and songs performed by monks while celebrating religious rituals in temples.

children.name: Chöd
children.description: Tibetan Buddhist and Bönpo practice incorporating ritualized liturgical chants and instrumental accompaniment from the chöd damaru, drilbu, and kangling.

children.name: Shōmyō
children.description: Japanese Buddhist chant that utilizes the yō scale.

children.name: Tibetan Buddhist Chant
children.description: Ritual vocal music of the Tibetan Buddhist faith characterized by its low pitch, droning repetitiousness, and frequent use of overtone singing.
